intro: Lycianthes biflora subsp. lysimachioides, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a herbaceous plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in open woodland or disturbed areas. It has simple, alternate leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
